intro: Duguetia glabra, commonly known as the white-leafed tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Duguetia glabra is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
